page.title: 12Llanharan Colliery
page.content: Llanharan stands on the Southern outcrop of the{South Wales Coalfield.} The first pit was opened in 1870 but was later closed because of difficult geological condtions and flooding. In the early 1920's the{Powell-Dyffryn {Company}decided to try again by linking Llanharan Pit to Llantrisant colliery. The Pit was sunk at Llanharan in 1939. In 1942 Llantrisant was damaged by an explosion so the link was never made. Powell-Dyffryn tried to link Llanharan mine to disused Meiros mine but this was abandoned because of flooding in the old mine. Llanharan mine was worked until difficult conditions and floods made it uneconomical and it was closed in 1962. The old colliery site is now used for washeries and sidings for the transportationon of the coal from the near by {opencast}site.
